title: HIGHLIGHTS-Rugby-Super Rugby week two
text: February 23, 2018 / 11:36 AM / a day ago Super Rugby week two (Reuters) - Highlights from week two of Super Rugby: REBELS 45 REDS 19 The Rebels started their season with a record-breaking victory over a Reds side who lost captain Scott Higginbotham to a red card following a dangerous tackle after 10 minutes. The Melbourne-based side, statistically the worst team in the competition in 2017, ran in seven tries, their most ever in a Super Rugby fixture, and scored the most points by the team in a single game as they made their numerical advantage count. Winger Sefanaia Naivalu, fullback Dane Haylett-Petty and flyhalf Jack Debreczeni crossed for two tries each to go with a score for centre Tom English. The Rebels, down to 13 players for 10 minutes when lock Lukhan Tui was sent to the sin-bin in the first half, managed tries through centres Duncan Paia‘aua and Samu Kerevi, and winger Chris Feauai-Sautis. READ MORE Record-breaking Rebels thump 14-man Reds in Super Rugby opener Walden brace helps Highlanders beat Blues in thriller All Blacks fullback Barrett to return from shoulder injury OTHER RUGBY NEWS Wales’ Six Nations hopes rest on beating Ireland - Biggar Ireland’s Furlong, Henderson miss out on Wales clash Hughes returns for England against Scotland Italy make two changes against France in Six Nations Scotland stick with winning team to face England France reshuffle back line to face Italy Troubled France weakened ahead of Italy clash in Six Nations Lions boost as Wales make three changes to team Sober Scotland to forget about the hype against England Champions Cup organiser to summon Toulon owner over homophobic comment HIGHLANDERS 41 BLUES 34 Inside centre Teihorangi Walden scored two tries while the Auckland Blues were reduced to 14 men to give the Otago Highlanders a 41-34 victory in Dunedin. The Highlanders had been trailling 31-24 when Blues replacement flanker Antonio Kiri Kiri was yellow-carded for a high tackle and the home side seized the opportunity to take a lead they did not relinquish. Walden’s centre partner Rob Thompson also grabbed two tries, while flyhalf Bryn Gatland, winger Matt Duffie and number eight Akira Ioane (two) replied for the visitors. Compiled by Greg Stutchbury and Nick Said,; Editing by Ed Osmond
